did.abstract: These papers contain receipts for furnishings and work done to James L.D. O'Reilly's properties in Manhattan and Brooklyn, as well as receipts from St. John's College, Brooklyn, for tuition and costs for his son Aloysius J. O'Reilly.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: James L.D. O'Reilly resided at 4314 4th Avenue in Brooklyn and ran a coffee and tea business at 55 South Street in Manhattan.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); James L.D. O'Reilly papers, 1978.058, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These papers span the period 1895 to 1928 and contain receipts for furnishings and work done to James L.D. O'Reilly's properties in Manhattan and Brooklyn. Also included are receipts from St. John's College, Brooklyn, for tuition and costs for his son Aloysius J. O'Reilly.
